You can try another burn program like the ImgBurn, but you should first try this (Read Me file):
1. Burn the Disc at the lowest possible speed.
2. Don't use old scratched Discs.
3. Try to clean your Optical disc drive(s).
4. Use another Optical disc drive.
5. Try to install Windows XP from a USB Flash drive (WinToFlash).

No program (archiver or CD Burner) recognizes this file.  Tried it as is and also tried adding .iso to the end.  What am I doing wrong?

The downloaded file is a ZIP file and in there is the ISO file that you should extract.
To see the file extensions disable the option at:
START -> Control Panel -> Folder Option -> Hide extemsions for know file types

Need some help, I got it extracted, got it burned to CD using ImgBurn.

Now I did a test, used a single SSD (formatted correctly) and it can load.  But I have two mech. hard drives, I set them up as RAID0 in BIOS and in the Intel Matrix Storage area.  Windows XP loads, either using my Intel drivers or the Windows XP ones, then I get to the "Welcome to Setup" screen.  Hit Enter to install and it immediately says it cannot detect the drive(s)

It only works if there is just a single drive whether one mech. or one SSD.

Is this O/S for RAID or is there something else?  Both drives formatted (not quick), using ICH5R board which had a RAID set up.  I want to try out this version of Windows.

Can anyone chime in if they have installed this in a RAID?

Just tried another XP I had (not a spare though) and it works for RAID.

Any help would be great.

Again i tried using a floppy with the RAID drivers and also tried just using what the ISO has, no joy.  :-(
I didn't had any problems last time with a RAID system but PM me over the website so i can send you a version without the RAID5 patch in it so you can try if that fixes your problem.
